remarks: Two ways to say that a subset has an empty interior.  (Contributed by NM, 3-Oct-2007.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 11-Nov-2013.)
statement:
clscld.1 $e |- X = U. J $.
ntreq0 $p |- ( ( J e. Top /\ S C_ X ) -> ( ( ( int ` J ) ` S ) = (/) <-> A. x e. J ( x C_ S -> x = (/) ) ) ) $.
$d J x $.
$d S x $.
$d X x $.
